content: For the contributor survey we have some questions that ask about experiences people have had within their team and I think that these questions need to be restructured to account for the possibility of people being involved in multiple teams
https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/issues/62
is there any sort of prior art for a question like this or should I try to come up with something from scratch?
We ran into this a little bit in the annual survey (in a question that isn't super important), and we didn't really come up with a good solution. I'd be happy to brainstorm with you on this
sounds good
on a related note, we have setup a survey hero account right? And if so, can I get access to that?
I want to see what surveyhero supports since I think that will significantly limit the ways we can actually structure these questions

Jane Lusby said:

on a related note, we have setup a survey hero account right? And if so, can I get access to that?

We don't yet. You can create a free account to play around with it. I'll be working with @simulacrum on getting an account set up
@Jane Lusby [she/her] if there's problems with surveyhero, it would be good to flag them (particularly if one of the alternative platforms would be better), so a trial definitely sounds good
@Jane Lusby [she/her] in particular, I am somewhat blocking on this concern, so if you can clarify/resolve it/indicate OK with surveyhero for the current set of surveys I think that would be good.
It would be good to try to get this settled ASAP so we can start next week to move the community survey into the survey platform

@Jane Lusby [she/her] @simulacrum If there are any specific questions I can answer, please let me know. From my research/experience the SurveyHero platform is pretty flexible - if there is a question structure/format of particular concern I'm happy to help troubleshoot.
I'll check it out right away
so it seems like we're pretty limited in how we can handle the multiple copies of a team specific question issue
and I'm worried that the available options all pose a risk of de anonymizing people's responses
so I'm thinking maybe we should try to word the questions such that we're only ever asking about one team
though I'm also still worried about this throwing away useful context

like, we could ask about how satisfied they are with their teams governance structure, and then have a note saying "if you're involved in multiple teams, please answer this question about the team you're least satisfied with / most worried about"
or we could ask them to answer it about the average across their team involvement
or ask them to only answer considering the team they're most involved in
Screenshot-from-2021-10-14-10-22-17.png
so I can have a multiple choice question that indicates how many teams there are
and then I can have multiple copies of the question, where the first one shows for any option other than 0, the second shows for 2, or 3, the third for 3, etc
but then we still have the same problem if they're in 3 or more teams
I could analyze the teams repo and figure out whats the highest number of teams / groups that any single person is involved in
but then its really easy to figure out who answered a survey whenever they get up near those high numbers
and I don't want people to feel worried about their answers being traced back to them if they're going to voice complaints
I'm gonna email their support real quick to see if they have any recommendations for how to handle this kind of situation
then I'm gonna see if I can't make some accounts on the other survey platforms we considered and try to encode the same sort of question to see how the options compare

From what I see, Qualtrics looks to be the only platform that includes the ability to display questions based on text entry fields. We could set up a multiple choice with as many options as we need to capture all the teams.
As we don't seem to be structuring this to provide information on specific teams, if we're worried about maintaining anonymity we may want to look at the more general question approaches above.

"In general, how satisfied are you with the governance structure within your teams?"
scale

"Are there any issues or concerns you have regarding governance within your teams?"
Text entry
That work's for me
Alright I've gone ahead and updated the contributor survey questions based on your advice @Jasun Carr
https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/109
@simulacrum I'm fairly confident that the above version of the questions can all be represented via SurveyHero
it also looks like I can just encode the entire survey on my personal free account and transfer it to our team account once we set one up
So once we're confident we're going to stick with surveyhero I will probably just immediately start porting over the survey from the markdown doc
